doc.previous: A number of isopod groups have evolved a parasitic lifestyle particularly as external parasites of fish 9 They can damage or kill their hosts and can cause significant economic loss to commercial fisheries 16 In reef aquariums parasitic isopods can become a pest endangering the fish and possibly injuring the aquarium keeper Some members of the family Cirolanidae suck the blood of fish and others in the family Aegidae consume the blood fins tail and flesh and can kill the fish in the process 17
doc.after: The World Marine Freshwater and Terrestrial Isopod Crustaceans database subdivides the order into eleven suborders 1
